page.title: 07Local Government, Warbleton
page.content: The Parish of Warbleton has a Parish Council consisting of 11 Councillors who meet six times a year in the Dunn Village Hall. The main items of business are planning matters with particular reference to the illegal siting of caravans, the maintenance of footpaths and the upkeep of the green and car park at Rushlake Green, both of which belong to the Council. Road safety, the retention of public telephone boxes and civil defence are all matters which have been raised at meetings during 1985. Although the meetings are open to the public, rarely do more than a few attend. The Council employs a part-time Clerk who draws a salary of Â£550 per year, but it pays neither the time nor expenses of Councillors. Its activities are financed by a Parish Rate and its current annual budget is around Â£1700.
